result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard N Schauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
Concurrent with: Sentence now serving in Walworth County Case 2013CF000146

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
---------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent, including mandatory completion of Anger Management counseling. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------------

Defendant Richard N Schauer in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Matthew Leusink and Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD:  
This case is scheduled for FPT today with a Jury Trial set for June 20 and 21, 2016 before Judge Reddy
Attorney Johnson was present in Court for the State
Attorney Raff appeared for the defendant, Mr. Schauer, on behalf of Attorney Schwantes
Mr. Schauer appeared in court, in custody
Parties stated they are prepared to proceed to trial on June 20 and 21.
Case confirmed by trial.

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  Defendant Richard N Schauer in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This matter is set for jury trial next week Monday.  Both the State and the Defense have made speedy trial demands.  Court notes that the defendant is not being held on a cash bond on this file.  He is currently in custody because his probation has been revoked and he is awaiting sentencing after revocation.  The Court is going to schedule that matter for hearing and will reschedule the Jury Trial on this case as a "speedy trial".  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Motion Hearing before the Hon. David M. Reddy on December 18, 2015
Court reporter: Sandra Elderbrook

Defendant Richard N Schauer in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:33 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Attorney Valerian Powell appears on behalf of the State.  
The defendant is present, in custody, and appears with his Attorney Travis Schwantes.  
Matter is before the Court on the State's Motion to Introduce Other Acts Evidence.  
Attorney Powell files a 908.08 Motion at this time.  
Court does a Sullivan analysis.  
Discussion between Court and Attorneys.  
Court hears argument of Attorneys.  
Court grants State's Motion and will allow the evidence.  
Minutes filed.  
3:20 p.m.  Court in recess.

Court in session @ 3:57 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for preliminary hearing.
3:58 p.m. - State calls Detective Michael Lambert who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Johnson. Exhibit #1 identified as copy of criminal complaint. State moves exhibit #1 into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received.
4:00 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Schwantes
4:03 p.m. - Re-direct by ADA Johnson
4:04 p.m. - Witness excused. No further witnesses. Evidence closed. Court makes a finding that probable cause exists and binds the defendant over for trial.
Information filed - read by attorney
NOT GUILTY PLEA AND TRIAL RESERVED. SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND BY THE STATE
Court in recess @ 4:10 p.m.

Defendant Richard Schauer present in court, in custody. Atty Julia May appeared. Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Atty May granted. Minutes filed.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.
